prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Determine the coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector also set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This sets the default position of the 2D sketch plane. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw rectangular face with four lines on the 2D sketch plane for face 1. Name the lines as below: Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], End point [0.75, 0.0] Line 2: Start point [0.75, 0.0], End point [0.75, 0.4368] Line 3: Start point [0.75, 0.4368], End point [0.0, 0.4368] Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.4368], End point [0.0, 0.0] Loops are used to connect a chain of edges seamlessly. Ensure that the above four lines form one loop (loop_1) and the loop is closed. Also, make sure that a loop can consist of multiple lines and/or arcs, but not a mix of lines and circles or arcs and circles. After drawing and assembling loops, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch scale parameter provided in the description. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system and apply the given extrude_depth_towards_normal and extrude_depth_opposite_normal values to extrude the 2D sketch along the normal and opposite normal respectively. Use the provided sketch_scale factor in the operation to create the 3D prism. Arrived at the final shape, a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom of length 0.75, width 0.75 and height 0.5756. The instructions provided above would help the junior CAD designer to generate an accurate CAD model for part 1. By following these steps, the desired part can be created in the context of the final shape as inferred from the VLM model. However, it's essential to reiterate that these instructions should be followed without making any assumptions other than the ones explicitly stated. This will ensure the desired CAD model is built as intended.</description>
completion:

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.4368]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.4368],"End Point":[0.0,0.4368]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.4368],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5756,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For the sketch, draw a rectangle on face 1 of the coordinate system. This rectangle will have 4 lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.75] 3. Line 3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.75] 4. Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion method is `NewBodyFeatureOperation`, with an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.1828 units and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. After this step, you will have a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom where the length, width, and height are 0.75 units, 0.75 units, and 0.1828 units, respectively. **Part 2: Construct a recessed rectangular part** Create a new coordinate system with a slight translation from the previous part to position the base at [0.0938, 0.5156, 0.1828]. The orientation remains the same with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For the sketch, draw a rectangle on face 1 that is smaller in size than the rectangle in Part 1. This rectangle will have 4 lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.1406, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point = [0.1406, 0.0], End Point = [0.1406, 0.1406] 3. Line 3: Start Point = [0.1406, 0.1406], End Point = [0.0, 0.1406] 4. Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.1406], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model using the `CutFeatureOperation`. The cutting between the two shapes occurs only in the opposite direction of the normal, penetrating by 0.0469 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1406. This part of the CAD model is a recessed rectangular part inserted in the main body of the prism. The length, width, and height of the recessed rectangular part are 0.1406 units, 0.1406 units, and 0.0469 units, respectively. With these detailed instructions in hand, a junior CAD designer should have no difficulty generating an accurate CAD model based on the given assembly JSON input.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following specifications: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2679, 0.0] For the sketch (face_1), create a loop (loop_1) with the following curves: - line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.6964] - line_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.6964], End Point = [0.0, 0.6964] - line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.6964], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] All the lines are connected to form a closed loop. This loop represents the perimeter of the top and bottom faces of the prism. Now, extrude the sketch by the specified "extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal" value of 0.2679 units, and set "extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal" to 0. This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.2679 units - Height: 0.75 units Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top by creating a new coordinate system with the following specifications: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1607, 0.0, 0.0804] For the sketch (face_1), create a loop (loop_1) with the following curves: - line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.4286, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point = [0.4286, 0.0], End Point = [0.4286, 0.5357] - line_3: Start Point = [0.4286, 0.5357], End Point = [0.0, 0.5357] - line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.5357], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] All the lines are connected to form a closed loop. This loop represents the perimeter of the top and bottom faces of the tapered prism. Now, extrude the sketch by setting "extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal" to 0 and the "extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal" value to 0.2143 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top cut out from the previous part. The dimensions are as follows: - Length: 0.5357 units - Width: 0.2143 units - Height: 0.5357 units</description>

Draw a line (line\\_1) starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.7286, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line (line\\_2) starting at [0.7286, 0.0] and ending at [0.7286, 0.4714]. 3. Close the loop to complete face\\_1 of the sketch. Now, define the boolean operation for this part as cutting an existing body.
